site_description: A database for the fission yeast Schizosaccharomyces japonicus
welcome_message: JaponicusDB is a comprehensive knowledgebase for the fission yeast Schizosaccharomyces japonicus, providing literature curation, analysis tools, and genome annotation. JaponicusDB is currently the only knowledgebase maintained entirely by community curation.

footer.funders:
JaponicusDB was established with support from the Wellcome Trust.
The S. japonicus community maintains JaponicusDB, led by the Francis Crick Institute and King's College London, with contributions from PomBase (University of Cambridge).

topDescription.text: Shortcuts for commonly used queries
Enter or upload a list of systematic gene IDs or gene names
UniProt accession mapping has moved
Retrieve genes via annotated Gene Ontology terms that describe the activity, process, or location of their products (protein or ncRNA)
Retrieve genes based on mutant phenotypes annotated using Fission Yeast Phenotype Ontology (FYPO)
Retrieve genes based on product type. Note that "protein" includes dubious and transposon protein-coding genes; there is a prepared query that excludes both in the list of commonly used queries
Retrieve protein domains, features and motifs
Retrieve protein-coding genes by specific domains present in the products. To retrieve all domain-containing proteins, search for "IPR*" or "PF*"
Retrieve protein-coding genes based on features annotated using the protein sequence feature branch of the Sequence Ontology (SO)

subNodes.extraDescription: Examples: short motifs such as NLS or KEN box, signal sequence, cleaved region, helix

topDescription.text: Retrieve protein-coding genes by number of predicted transmembrane domains in the product
Retrieve protein-coding genes by number of predicted coiled-coil domains in the product
Retrieve protein-coding genes by number of disordered regions in the product
Retrieve protein-coding genes by number of low complexity regions in the product
Retrieve protein properties
Retrieve protein-coding genes by product length (in amino acids)
Retrieve protein-coding genes by product molecular weight in kDa
Transcript and exons properties
Retrieve genes by number of exons in the primary transcript
Retrieve genes by number of transcript isoforms
Retrieve genes by spliced RNA length in nucleotides (not including UTRs for protein coding genes)
Retrieve genes by un-spliced RNA length in nucleotides (not including UTRs for protein coding genes)
Retrieve genes in a specified region of a chromosome
Retrieve proteins that have an ortholog in

front_page_panels.title: Gu et al., 2015
front_page_panels.content: Rewiring of cellular division site selection in evolution of fission yeasts. Originally published in Curr Biol.

front_page_panels.title: Gómez-Gil et al., 2020
front_page_panels.content: Stress-activated MAPK signalling controls fission yeast actomyosin ring integrity by modulating formin For3 levels. Originally published in eLife. Image from [eLife 2020;9:e57951](https://elifesciences.org/articles/57951#fig8), used under [CC-BY](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/) license terms.

front_page_panels.title: An et al., 2021
front_page_panels.content: Mis16 Independently Recognizes Histone H4 and the CENP-ACnp1-Specific Chaperone Scm3sp. Originally published in J Mol Biol.

front_page_panels.title: Kinnaer et al., 2021
front_page_panels.content: Yeast-to-hypha transition of Schizosaccharomyces japonicus in response to environmental stimuli. Originally published in Mol Biol Cell.

front_page_panels.title: M. Sipiczki et al., 1998
front_page_panels.content: Environmentally controlled dimorphic cycle in a fission yeast. Originally published in Microbiology (Reading).

front_page_panels.title: E. Chapman et al. 2022
front_page_panels.content: Separable roles for RNAi in regulation of transposable elements and viability in the fission yeast Schizosaccharomyces japonicus. Originally published in PLOS Genetics

front_page_panels.title: Okamoto S. et al. 2013
front_page_panels.content: Synchronous activation of cell division by light or temperature stimuli in the dimorphic yeast Schizosaccharomyces japonicus. Originally published in Eukaryotic Cell

front_page_panels.title: Data mining
front_page_panels.content: Use the [Advanced Search](/query) to construct complex queries (GO, phenotypes, taxonomic distribution, domain, chromosomal location).

front_page_panels.title: Help!
front_page_panels.content: JaponicusDB provides extensive documentation and answers many questions in the [FAQ](faq). For any information you can't find there, please <app-contact-email [linkName]="'contact the helpdesk'" [subject]="'JaponicusDB question'"></app-contact-email>.

front_page_panels.title: Community curation in Canto
front_page_panels.content: PomBase has pioneered a community curation system that enables researchers to contribute publication-based annotations directly to database curators. To participate, search for the PubMed ID of your paper [in Canto](https://curation.pombase.org/pombe) or <app-contact-email [linkName]="'contact the helpdesk'" [subject]="'PomBase question'"></app-contact-email>.

term.name: transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding
RNA polymerase II proximal promoter sequence-specific DNA binding

ISS.long: Inferred from Sequence or Structural Similarity

IBA.long: Inferred from Biological aspect of Ancestor

IBD.long: Inferred from Biological aspect of Descendant

HDA.long: Inferred from high throughput direct assay

HEP.long: Inferred from high throughput expression pattern

HGI.long: Inferred from high throughput genetic interaction

HMP.long: Inferred from high throughput mutant phenotype

evidence_codes: Sodium dodecyl sulfate polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis

external_gene_references.name: STRING
external_gene_references.description: Network display of known and predicted interactions and functional associations

cc_goslim_japonicus.description: S. pombe high level GO cellular component terms
cc_goslim_japonicus.slim_results_description: A "GO slim" is a subset of the Gene Ontology terms selected for a specific purpose in interpreting the functional annotations in an entire organism, or a gene product list derived from an experiment.

bp_goslim_japonicus.description: S. pombe high level GO biological process terms
bp_goslim_japonicus.slim_results_description: A "GO slim" is a subset of the Gene Ontology terms selected for a specific purpose in interpreting the functional annotations in an entire organism, or a gene product list derived from an experiment.  PomBase has created a GO slim to provide a simple summary of S. pombe's biological capabilities by grouping gene products using broad biological process classifiers.

terms.name: establishment or maintenance of cell polarity
generation of precursor metabolites and energy
protein modification by small protein conjugation or removal

mf_goslim_japonicus.description: S. pombe high level GO molecular function terms
mf_goslim_japonicus.slim_results_description: A "GO slim" is a subset of the Gene Ontology terms selected for a specific purpose in interpreting the functional annotations in an entire organism, or a gene product list derived from an experiment.

terms.name: catalytic activity, acting on a protein
catalytic activity, acting on a tRNA
hydrolase activity, acting on carbon-nitrogen (but not peptide) bonds
hydrolase activity, acting on ester bonds
hydrolase activity, acting on glycosyl bonds
phosphotransferase activity, for other substituted phosphate groups
transferase activity, transferring aldehyde or ketonic groups
transferase activity, transferring alkyl or aryl (other than methyl) groups

fypo_slim.description: High level fission yeast phenotype terms
fypo_slim.slim_results_description: A "slim" is a high-level subset of terms from an ontology, used to analyze sets of annotated genes. PomBase has created a slim from the Fission Yeast Phenotype Ontology (FYPO) to provide a summary of fission yeast phenotypes.

attr_values.name: generation of precursor metabolites and energy
